Package org.usfirst.frc2084.CMonster2014.drive

Contains all the drive code and algorithms for the robot.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ArcadeDriveAlgorithm
    Implements the control of a drive controller using with arcade style controls.
    DriveAlgorithm
    This class acts as a bridge between a HID (joystick, gamepad) and a DriveController.
    DriveController
    Controls a set of wheels.
    DriveUtils
    This class contains some useful methods for driving.
    FourWheelDriveController
    Drive controller for robots with four wheels.
    MecanumDriveAlgorithm
    A DriveAlgorithm that uses a FourWheelDriveController (which controls four mecanum wheels) to drive using a gyro to maintain orientation and drive relative to the field.
    TwoWheelDriveController
    Controls a robot that has two wheels, or (in most cases) two sides that each act as a unit, making the control the same as if the robot only had two wheels.
    WheelController
    Controls a single wheel with an arbitrary number of motors.

Package org.usfirst.frc2084.CMonster2014.drive Description

Contains all the drive code and algorithms for the robot. Here are some standard conventions for all drive code:
  • forward = positive
  • reverse = negative
  • right = positive
  • left = negative
  • clockwise = positive
  • counterclockwise = negative
  • full speed/power = +/-1.0
  • off/neutral = 0.0
  • distance units = meters
  • angle units = radians
Some of these things are not totally consistent yet, but I'm working on it.
Author:
Ben Wolsieffer
